stories.text:
I’ve been asked recently by a buddy who’s kid (13) wants to learn programming but isn’t sure where is best to start. My gut feeling is something like Python might make the most sense, but wanted to ask the room.

Criteria I’m working on are:

1) Ease to get to “Hello World”. 2) Kid-friendly, easily available learning resources. 3) Low setup complexity.

It’s been so long since I’ve been there (VB6!) that it’s harder to know in 2022 what the right advice to give is for someone just starting out.

I also thought about steering them to HTML first, but I don’t think the open web as the same draw that it did for me back in the day.

What do you folks think?
stories.title: Ask HN: Which programming language for a first-time coder in 2022?
Show HN: MMAP_ninja: a library fo storing ML datasets in memory mapped format

stories.text:
I am at a point where I'd like to give another go at business ownership (but retain my 9-5, which I enjoy).

I have a ton of failed app/websites I've attempted, built/owned a bar, and have been brainstorming on what I would like to do next.

My current plan is to start investing in real estate (flips and multi-unit rentals) but as I think about things I see a lot of parallels with owning "digital properties". I am curious if anyone has had success (defined as growing the MoM cashflow) with buying a site from somewhere like empireflippers in the 50-100k investment range? What did the process look like? What are the risks and got yas?
stories.title: Ask HN: Buying a Website as an Investment?
